heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 24 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3911 lux) and cloud levels (up 357 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5460 lux) and cloud levels (up 521 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 357.3m lower than yesterday, 152.4m lower than the past week, 521.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 794m minimum and 2000m maximum, with an average of 839.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 992.2m and 1360.8m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.9°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
